tafseer.tafsir: Allah swears by the night when it covers, that is when the night has evenly covered this nature. This is evening time, that is, when the red light has disappeared on the western horizon. At that time, humans generally have ended their activities, and want to rest and go to sleep. Then Allah swears by nature's activities on the contrary, namely during the day when it is bright. It was the time of Duha when the sunlight was evenly shining on this nature, which contrasted with the night that had just ended, and humans started working.

Allah swears by the night when it covers, that is when the night has evenly covered this nature. This is evening time, that is, when the red light has disappeared on the western horizon. At that time, humans generally have ended their activities, and want to rest and go to sleep. Then Allah swears by nature's activities on the contrary, namely during the day when it is bright. It was the time of Duha when the sunlight was evenly shining on this nature, which contrasted with the night that had just ended, and humans started working.
Furthermore, Allah swears by the male and female that He has created. These are also two creatures of opposite sex and nature.

After swearing by two of His creatures that are of opposite sex and nature, Allah confirms that human actions or behavior are indeed various. The difference occurs because of differences in willingness, whether to follow the positive potential or follow the negative potential.

In this verse, Allah explains that there are three human behaviors. First, like to give, that is to help between fellow human beings. He does not only issue zakat on his wealth, which is an obligation, but also spends, gives alms, and so on which is not obligatory. Second, piety, namely fear of ignoring His commands or violating His prohibitions. Third, justifying God's goodness, namely acknowledging the blessings that have been given to him and then being grateful for them. God's greatest favor that he acknowledged was heaven. Therefore, he does not hesitate to do good in the world to get it, including helping fellow human beings. For those who do the three aspects of good deeds above, Allah will make it easy for them, namely the ease to get good luck in this world and in the hereafter.

On the other hand, there are humans who behave in the opposite way. He is stingy, stingy, does not want to help others, let alone pay out his obligation, namely zakat. Besides that, he already had enough of everything. Therefore, he feels he does not need anyone else, not even Allah. As a result, he is arrogant and does not acknowledge the favors of Allah that he has received and does not expect those favors. As a result he did not heed the rules of God. That person will be facilitated by Allah towards difficulties, both difficulties in this world and in the hereafter. Difficulties in the world such as fall, illness, accident, calamity, and so on. Difficulties in the afterlife are torments whose peak is hell. Humans, if they die without having charity and then go to hell in the hereafter, then their property and wealth will be of no use whatsoever. That's because the treasure will not be used to atone for their sins.

Allah confirms that He is obliged to show humans which way is right and which way is wrong, which is good and which is bad, as He stated in another verse: And when those who believe in Our verses come to you, then say , "Salamun 'alaikum (peace be upon you)." Your Lord has determined the quality of compassion for Himself, (namely) whoever commits evil among you out of ignorance, then he repents after that and corrects himself, then He is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful. (al-An'am/6: 54)
Allah is also the owner of this world, both the hereafter and the world. If Allah owns everything, then there is no way for humans but to ask Him for all of that by having faith and fearing Him.

Besides Allah has shown people the right path, He has also warned people about the existence of a hell which is always burning. The inhabitants of hell are those who are the most disobedient, namely people who always view the revelations conveyed to them as lies, and therefore do not want to believe in them and carry them out.
